elements.content: From Pilot to Production in 6-8 Weeks

deliverables: Discovery call: Data sources, volumes, platforms
Architecture review: Where to deploy agents
Shadow mode enabled: Observe, don't modify
Query validation: Confirm no data loss
Scale to additional data sources (2-10 sources)
Policy tuning based on production data
Scale to remaining data sources (all sources)
Training: Operations team on day-2 management
First QBR: Review savings, identify improvements

elements.content: ‚è±Ô∏è Total Time: 6-8 weeks from kickoff to full production ‚Ä¢ üí∞ First Savings: Week 5 ‚Ä¢ üéØ Target Achievement: Week 8

visual_language.color_coding: Different colors for different phase types

presentation_notes.opening: Let me walk you through what the implementation timeline looks like‚Äîfrom kickoff to full production.

phase_by_phase.phase_1: [Point to phase 1] Week one is kickoff and discovery. We do a discovery call to understand your data sources, volumes, and platforms. Architecture review to determine where to deploy agents. Define success criteria‚Äîyour target percentage reduction. And scope the pilot‚Äîwe'll pick 1 to 2 data sources to start with. Participants: Sales, solutions engineering, your architects. Output: A pilot plan document.
phase_by_phase.phase_2: [Point to phase 2] Weeks two and three are the pilot deployment in shadow mode. We install agents‚ÄîKubernetes, Docker, or VM‚Äîyour choice. Shadow mode is enabled‚Äîagents observe but don't modify anything. We collect baseline metrics for 2 weeks. And we develop policies‚Äîthe filter, transform, and route rules. Participants: Solutions engineering and your DevOps or SRE team. Output: A savings analysis report. Milestone: We validate that 50 to 70% reduction is achievable.
phase_by_phase.phase_3: [Point to phase 3] Week four is validation and business case. We deliver a savings report with the actual percentage reduction measured. Query validation to confirm no data was lost. ROI calculation‚Äîa 3-year financial model. And a go/no-go decision meeting. Participants: Your exec sponsor, finance, and engineering. Output: Business case approval. This is a decision point.
phase_by_phase.phase_4: [Point to phase 4] Weeks five and six are production rollout. We flip from shadow to active mode. Canary rollout‚Äî10% traffic, then 50%, then 100%. Monitoring setup‚Äîdashboards and alerts. And we scale to additional data sources‚Äî2 to 10 sources depending on complexity. Participants: Solutions engineering, your SRE, and operations. Output: Production environment live. Milestone: First savings realized.
phase_by_phase.phase_5: [Point to phase 5] Weeks seven and eight are optimization and expansion. Policy tuning based on production data. Scale to remaining data sources‚Äîall sources. Training for your operations team on day-2 management. And first quarterly business review‚Äîwe review savings and identify improvements. Participants: Customer success and your operations team. Output: Full production deployment. Milestone: Target savings achieved.

presentation_notes.summary: [Point to bottom] Total time: 6 to 8 weeks from kickoff to full production. First savings: Week 5. Target achievement: Week 8.
presentation_notes.flexibility: This timeline is typical, but we can compress or extend based on your needs. Fastest we've done: 4 weeks. Slowest: 12 weeks for highly complex environments.
presentation_notes.when_to_use: Use this slide when prospects ask: 'What's the implementation process?' 'How long until we see savings?' 'What's involved?'

executives.talking_points: Fast time-to-value, clear milestones, measurable outcomes

technical_teams.talking_points: Shadow mode safety, canary rollout, technical deliverables

operations.talking_points: Training provided, operational handoff, ongoing support

when_not_to_show: With prospects not yet committed to evaluation

customization_notes.adjust_timeline: If customer has constraints (e.g., 'must go live in 4 weeks'), show compressed timeline
customization_notes.add_dependencies: If customer has specific requirements (e.g., security review, compliance audit), add those as phases
customization_notes.highlight_customer_responsibilities: Make clear what customer team needs to provide (access, decisions, resources)
